supportDesc.condition: The sewing has been crudely repaired with modern synthetic threads. The textblock is held together by stitch repairs. Some leaves are slightly stained with water: 137, 138, 153v, 154r, 155v, 156r. A few words are illegible or barely legible on 1rb, ls. 9-11. Cuts amended on 16, 76, 77, 86, 89, 133, 148, 153, 156.

layout.ab: Number of lines varies from 24 (e.g., 77va) to 36 (e.g., 59va).
The upper line is written above the ruling (sometimes below the ruling: e.g., 97v, 119v, 120r, 141r).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The arrangement of the columns is rather unstable.
The scribe sometimes did not use the last ruled line: e.g., 6v, 15r, 22r, 28v, 31v, 34v.
The upper line is written above the ruling (sometimes below the ruling: e.g., 35v-44r).

handNote.seg: Black (deep reddish brown on 46ra l.16-48rb l. 9), red

Several lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page; several lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page of each section; the name of Mary on fol. 120ra; names of the feasts in the upper margin of the fols.; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

handDesc.handNote: Hand a: 1r-34v, 58r-156r, broadly spaced letters (except 24va-26vb, 28ra-34ra, 58r-74v) with curved left-sloping letter shapes.
- ደ has the 6th order marker slanted to the left
- የ has the 7th order marker usually slanted to the left
- the loop marking the 5th order is sometimes open.
Hand b: 35r-57v, characterized by angular right-sloping letter shapes.
It is possible that another hand was involved in the writing (s. e.g., 58r-74v).
- the upper horizontal stroke of መ is usually slanted to the left
- ፀ has a rectangular shape, esp. in the 5th order
- መ has the loops usually not separated, esp. in the 4th order.

decoDesc.decoNote: 1r (incipit page of Text I-1): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, blue, outlined in black) ornamental frame, with a horizontal band reaching the top pf the page; interlaces, crosses.
